page.title: 14Flora and Fauna
page.content: The dominant tree is the Oak, with other hardwoods (no longer Elm), Willow, Alder, Holly and Field Maple.Mistletoe is common in orchards. Many wild flowers are found on banks and hedgerows, including wild snowdrops. The Hereford and Radnor Naturalists' Trust is active in the area, recording and protecting wild species of flowers and animals. Badgers, foxes and hedgehogs are well established but otters are now very uncommon. Footpaths and bridleways marked on the Ordnance Survey maps are often difficult to follow on the ground because too few people use them to keep them open.
